Damage: 2d6+3 piercing; DC 13 Str or knocked prone
Special Abilities: Pack Tactics: advantage on attacks if ally adjacent to target.
Thematic Use: Frozen wilderness patrol; pursues fleeing party through snow. Use in pairs or small packs.

Special Abilities: Pack Tactics. Cold Breath (recharge 5-6): 15 ft. cone; DC 12 Dex save; 4d8 cold (half on save). Immune to cold. Understands Common and Giant but rarely speaks.
Thematic Use: Apex wilderness predator. Use on the approach to the mountain for a serious outdoor encounter.

Special Abilities: Keen Smell: advantage on Perception (smell). Multiattack: claws then bite.
Thematic Use: Wilderness or underground den. Effective as a territorial encounter in or near the forest or tunnel entrances.

Special Abilities: Chilling Gaze: 30 ft.; DC 13 Con save or paralyzed 1 min (restrained on successful save). Keen Smell. Immune to cold.
Thematic Use: High-altitude encounter near the mine approach. The paralysis gaze creates strong action-economy pressure.

Damage: 1d8+3 piercing; DC 11 Con or 2d8 poison (half on save)
Special Abilities: Web (recharge 5-6): +5 to hit; target restrained (DC 12 Str to break free). Spider Climb. Web Sense.
Thematic Use: Underground tunnels or forested areas. Thematic tie to the Aani encounter - not her kin but of the same family. Use to reinforce the spider motif without making it feel toothless.

Special Abilities: Stone Camouflage: advantage on Stealth in rocky terrain. Resistance: B/P/S from non-magic weapons.
Thematic Use: Mine tunnels and cave walls. Lurks flush against rock; nearly invisible until it strikes. The damage resistance makes players second-guess their weapon choices.

Special Abilities: False Appearance: indistinguishable from a stalactite while motionless. After dropping: speed reduced to 5 ft. only - it cannot pursue.
Thematic Use: Mine ceilings; purely a surprise ambush creature. Effective in a narrow passage where players cannot easily spread out. Best used once - the trick loses power on repetition.

Special Abilities: Split: when hit by lightning or slashing damage (if >10 HP) it splits into two smaller jellies. Amorphous. Spider Climb. Immune: lightning / slashing. Resist: acid / cold / fire / thunder.
Thematic Use: Underground hazard; spreads into multiple threats if players use slashing weapons. Good for teaching players to pay attention to damage types.

Damage: 2d6+2 necrotic; target STR reduced by damage dealt (0 STR = DC 13 Con save or die)
Special Abilities: Shadow Stealth: Stealth +4 in dim light or darkness. Amorphous. Vulnerability: radiant. Resist: acid / cold / fire / lightning / thunder; B/P/S non-magic. Immune: necrotic / poison.
Thematic Use: Remnants of partially consumed souls near the mine. Mechanically dangerous due to STR drain - can disable martials fast. Use in dim-light environments to maximize Shadow Stealth. A killed Shadow may spawn a new Shadow from its host.

Damage: 3d6 necrotic; target HP max reduced by same amount until long rest
Special Abilities: Incorporeal Movement. Sunlight Sensitivity. Resist: acid / cold / fire / lightning / thunder; B/P/S non-magic. Immune: necrotic / poison.
Thematic Use: Lingering spirit of a harvested skinwalker or slave. The HP maximum reduction is the key threat - it compounds across a dungeon. Specters are what Shadows become when the soul is more intact. Narratively: these are the ones who remember what they were.

Damage: 4d8+4 necrotic; target HP max reduced by same amount until long rest
Special Abilities: Create Specter: humanoid reduced to 0 HP by the wraith spawns a specter from its soul. Incorporeal Movement. Sunlight Sensitivity. Resist: acid / cold / fire / lightning / thunder; B/P/S non-magic. Immune: necrotic / poison.
Thematic Use: A fully consumed skinwalker - what happens when the Master finishes the ritual. The Create Specter ability means this fight can spiral fast. Use sparingly; best as a reveal of what the sorcerer's process produces at its completion.

Special Abilities: Consume Life (bonus action vs. creature at 0 HP): DC 10 Con save or take 10d4 necrotic; wisp regains HP equal to damage dealt. Variable Illumination: can brighten or dim its glow freely. Ephemeral: can become invisible as a bonus action. Incorporeal. Immune: lightning / poison; B/P/S non-magic.
Thematic Use: Lures players deeper into the mine or into the forest at night - appears as a guiding light. AC 19 makes it extremely hard to hit with melee; players must use spells or ranged attacks. Devastating against low-HP targets who are already downed.
Slaver foot soldiers. Use in groups of 4-6 to create meaningful pressure without individual monster complexity. Easy to run; quantity is the threat.

Special Abilities: Pack Tactics: advantage on attacks if ally adjacent to target. Multiattack: two mace strikes per turn.
Thematic Use: Slaver enforcers. Pair with Bandits for a varied encounter - Thugs absorb damage up front while Bandits range. The Pack Tactics + multiattack combo makes a group of 3-4 Thugs a serious mid-tier fight.

Damage: Bite: 1d8+2 piercing + DC 11 Con or 2d8 poison (half on save) / Claws: 2d4+2 slashing
Special Abilities: Web (recharge 5-6): +4 to hit; target restrained (DC 11 Str to escape). Spider Climb. Web Sense. Web Walker.
Thematic Use: Web-filled tunnels deeper than Aani's cabin. Not her kin but of the same family - use to extend the spider theme into more hostile territory. Ettercaps are cunning enough to set ambushes: webs strung across corridors before the party arrives.
